vague_description: Determine the optimal number of regular and hybrid vans needed to meet delivery and pollution constraints.
detailed_description: A shipping company can purchase regular and hybrid vans to make deliveries. A regular van can deliver \param{PackagesRegular} packages per day and produces \param{PollutantsRegular} units of pollutants. A hybrid van can deliver \param{PackagesHybrid} packages per day and produces \param{PollutantsHybrid} units of pollutants. Due to a new environmental law, they can produce at most \param{MaxPollutants} units of pollutants per day. However, the company needs to be able to deliver at least \param{MinPackages} packages per day. How many of each type of van should they buy to minimize the total number of vans needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of vans needed
target_constraints: Number of regular vans is an integer
Number of hybrid vans is an integer
Number of regular vans is non-negative
Number of hybrid vans is non-negative
Regular vans can deliver PackagesRegular packages per day each
Hybrid vans can deliver PackagesHybrid packages per day each
Regular vans produce PollutantsRegular units of pollutants each
Hybrid vans produce PollutantsHybrid units of pollutants each
The company can produce at most MaxPollutants units of pollutants per day
The company needs to deliver at least MinPackages packages per day
target_parameters: Number of packages a regular van can deliver per day
Units of pollutants produced by a regular van per day
Number of packages a hybrid van can deliver per day
Units of pollutants produced by a hybrid van per day
Maximum allowable units of pollutants per day
Minimum number of packages needed to be delivered per day
